metadata.title: CVE-2022-22752 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers Christian Holler and Jason Kratzer reported memorysafety bugs present in Firefox 95. Some of these bugs showed evidence ofmemory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of thesecould have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 96.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '96.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
